task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 325°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the building (base to roofline), so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointing north instead of the intended ~325° toward the building, so I should rotate left to re-align to ~325° while keeping the upward pitch.
To estimate height I need both the roofline and a sense of floors, so I should tilt up to capture the top of the facade while staying aimed at the building.
The heading has again reset to 0° so I must rotate back to ~325° (35° left) to face the target building while keeping the upward pitch.
Instead of repeatedly tilting, I should now provide an estimate based on the visible number of stories and typical floor-to-floor height.
